Welcome to the Mahalaya app!


In this app, you can set the date and time when you want Mahalaya to be played. When the time comes, the app will automatically play Mahalaya using its inbuilt media player. This means that you do not need to download any third-party media player.


After the splash screen, you will have a screen showing you four options:
 1. Set program for today at 4 am,
 2. Set program for tomorrow at 4 am,
 3. Manually set a date and time, and
 4. Proceed to chose the files.


The first two will automatically set the date and time as they state. The first option may not be available depending on when you are starting the program. The third option will allow you to set a date and time according to your wish. You will be directed to a screen where you will can choose a date. After clicking Proceed to set time, you will go to another screen where you will be able to set the time. After this, you are required to select the media file.


If you choose any of the first two options, then you can directly go to media file selection screen by clicking on option 4.


Unfortunately this app does not contain the media file for Mahalaya. The size of the file is about 150 MB in mp4 format, and hence I decided not to pack that file with the app so that while downloading, your internal storage doesn't get full all of a sudden and your phone crashes. You can download the media file in mp4 or mp3 format from Google Drive through the links at the end.


Either after choosing options 1 or 2 from above, or after setting the time (i.e. if you chose option 3), you have to select the media file. This file can be placed anywhere - the internal storage or the microSD card, whichever is suitable for you. In the media selection screen, when you click on "Choose a media file", the file browser opens where you can select the file. Currently supported formats are mp4 and mp3 only. When you select the file, its path will be visible in the media selection screen.


Now you can start the program. Remember, once you do that, you cannot change the date and time without aborting the current instance of the program.


Once the countdown starts, you will be taken to a screen where you will be able to see the time left for Mahalaya to start. There will be an ongoing notification that will also show you the time left. You can safely exit the countdown screen; that will not hamper the program. If you click on the notification, you can come back to the this screen again.


The countdown screen also has an abort button. In case you want to stop the program, click this button.


Please remember to set a decent volume for the media player. If the media stream is muted, you will not be able to hear anything when Mahalaya starts.


Once the time arrives, the playback will start automatically. There will be a notification that will allow you to pause or re-start the media player. Clicking on this notification will take you to a screen that will show the time left for the media to end. There will be an abort button here as well, which will completely stop the playback and kill the app.


You can change the theme of the app by clicking the bulb icon in the toolbar.


If you have any question or suggestion, feel free to drop me an email at basulabs.developer@gmail.com and I shall be happy to help. If you have found a bug, please mention the exact steps so that I can reproduce it. A screen video will also be very helpful.


Thank you for trying this app.
